text: Cask at the Wellington; golden yellow pour with a bubbly off white head, aroma has tangerine and sweet malts, taste has citrus, pale malts, underlying pine.

(Cask at Craft Beer Co Islington, London, 21 April 2017) Golden colour with frothy, white head. Fruity nose with citrus, grainy malt and green apples. Malty, fruity taste with notes of citrus, biscuity malt, resin and a balanced citric bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Refreshing and tasty. Nice one.

Cask, 1/3 pint by gravity at Paisley Beer Festival 2017, Town Hall, Paisley on 20 Apr 2017, grassy, pine aroma, golden with a thin bubbly head and no lacing, earthy, citrus flavour, dry, bitter finish.

Cask, Mariners Great Yarmouth. 
Dark golden appearance with white lasting foam head with lacing. Light fruity and hoppy aroma. An initial bitter taste of hops and fruit gives way to a dry grass and slight caramel taste with malt. It goes down easy. Its slightly different and different enough to make it rather good.
Cask at The Hanging Bat. Clear golden. Nose is citrus, faint malts, little sweat. Tastes citrus, quite thin and easy, bitter, grainy malts. A bit too dry bitter finish for the body for my taste.

Aroma and taste is hoppy and malty, very green hoppy, some grassy twiggy type hoppy Brit action, light to medium body, assertive bitter hoppy finish.

On cask at the Hanging Bat. 
Appearance - golden with a decent head. 
Nose - lime and green stalks .
Taste - more of the above. A bit green pepper.
Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - food.
Cask at the Hanging Bat. Pours clear golden with a thick white head. Aromas of floral hops, light lemon. Taste has a hint of malt sweetness, earthy hops. Dry finish.
On cask at York Tap. Pours clear gold, fluffy white head. Aromas of apricots, floral, grassy, straw, resin. Taste is lightly bitter, green, fruity. Dry finish.

August 2016 - Cask handpull at GBBF 2016 as Tiny Rebel Fugg Life, an all British hopped pale ale. Amber orange, clear, still, foamy white head. Aroma is apple and tangerines. Body is smooth with soft carbonation. Taste is smooth malt, light biscuit, soft apple, citrus, some elderflower. Quite good. (3.5)

Cask @ Craft Beer Co - Covent Garden, Holborn WC1. Pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Fruity malty citrus hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy finish.

clean golden with medium off white head. Aroma is tangy crispy grassy with some oat and grass. Taste is also grassy tangy crispy with more lemon peel grass and wheat. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice one
Cask @ Pavement Vaults, York. Clear golden-amber with a thick creamy-frothy head. Light tasting pale ale thats slightly watery without feeling weak. Theres a pleasant dryness to its texture.

Cask conditioned at Cheltenham Beer Festival 16. Gold with white head. Reasonably hopped beer, citric peel, flowery and quite fruity. Some drying bitterness, clean and reasonably refreshing. Its fine.

Cask at GBBF 16, day one, 09/08/16.
Clear golden blonde with a decent off white head that dissipates to a swirl.
Nose is pale malts, straw, light pine flicker, orange pith, melon.
Taste comprises juicy citric peel, melon, soft bread, toasted grains, tangerine.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, seim drying close with a juicy hop closure.
Decent enough hoppy pale.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Tap takeover at Craft Beer Covent Garden, London. Clear golden beer with a small offwhite head. Hoppy citrus aroma, grassy, hay, floral notes. Hoppy grassy aroma, citrus, pine, hay notes. Ok.

Cask at GBBF 2016, Olympia, London. A golden coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Hoppy, malty, fruity aroma. Tastes hoppy, malty, fruity, slightly bitter. OK but not up to Tiny Rebels usual high standard.

Cask-conditioned at the Pelican, Gloucester 9/8/2016. Golden and vaguely hazy, with a decently sized white head. English hedgerow character aplenty, some sweetish rich tea malts and a length, bitter, finish. Good.
Cask handpull at GBBF 2016. Clear gold lasting off white head. Fuggles hoppy aroma. Definitely English hops. Hedgerow. Decent golden ale with Fuggles hops. Drying finish.
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours clear pale amber, nose is floral, sweaty toffee, taste is dry, toffee, floral.

Cask at CBC CV. Pours mostly clear gold with a creamy, white head. Lots of citrus peel in the nose, light grainy bread. Light to medium sweet flavour with more pale, grainy bread, tangerine. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with more pale grains and citrus fruits. Drinkable gear.

Cask at the CBC Holburn. During the tap takeover . A clear golden orange coloured pour with a speckled off white head. Aroma is pale grains, grape orange, tangy orange. Flavour is raw pale grains, straw, grape, zesty orange sessionable. Palate is thin grainy, slightly watery, lowish carbonation. Drying grain tannin in the finish.

Craft beer covent garden. Clear yellow golden color, average sized white head. Aroma is lightly malts and some hops. Taste is more malt forward, less hops or fruit hops at least, more malt bitter and hop bitter flavors. Average to decent body and carbonation.
Cask. Leicht trübes orange goldenes Bier mit mittelgroßen weißen schaumkrone. Geruch zitronig bitter hopfig. Geschmack mild hopfig bitter, zitronig, leicht harzig.
4.2 cask at hanging bat... Soft sweet dry fruit.. Soft fruits toffee fruit.. Light dry fruit.. Soft fruits
